Articles.Content: Hows Buran going?

Hows Buran going?

Yes, of course. more nuanced but generally everything is going well

I figured out how to shoot a little video tutorial here

So THAT'S what I did wrong. Built it in the wrong order.

*facepalm*

Okay, first launch completed. Time for some feedback from the field.

First impressions...

Upon loading: My god, this thing is a lag monster.

Upon Liftoff: Needs more boosters. TWR of 1.13 is NOT good.

After 15 seconds of flight: This thing flies like the pilots are drunk. It's weaving all over the place.

Booster Separation: Good clean sep. Love it. The RD-0120s need less gimbal control, though. Pitch, roll, and yaw transients became worse after losing the boosters.

Coasting to circularization burn: Core stage needs RCS or a reaction wheel. It's impossible to control.

Circularization burn: Too much gimbal. Tumbled out of control.

Overall assesment: Energia needs some refinement. I love the SMERCH and DM stages, though. They're flawless.

Overall assesment: Energia needs some refinement. I love the SMERCH and DM stages, though. They're flawless.

Great assessment I couldn't say it any better myself. I think you made a beautiful mod but for me at least it lags so much its pretty much unenjoyable. Now I do have a few mods not alot of mods more than average but way less then some people I have seen. I would like to use this mod in conjunction with those mods but as I said its just too laggy. Would you consider a low res version or even a version with toned down graphics. Again well done but just too laggy right now for me.

I don't think that it's the textures... it's the models. If he just pulled them from the webpage he listed on the OP... they're really high poly-count. That's the cause of the lag.

1.after separation "Block A", move the rear engines Pitch-Trim At least -5

2.What TWR: -D

3 Yes, I understand why the gap, it is necessary that the number of polygons not privyshaet 1000, try to launch a rocket without the "Buran T" I found it in abundance polygons will fix it

In addition to the rocket did not staggered like a drunken struts to fix it, and download a small plug of ferram4, is on the first page

Edited August 11, 2014 by DECQ
Another Buran? This'll go together nicely with Bobcat's Buran!

1.after separation "Block A", move the rear engines Pitch-Trim At least -5

2.What TWR: -D

3 Yes, I understand why the gap, it is necessary that the number of polygons not privyshaet 1000, try to launch a rocket without the "Buran T" I found it in abundance polygons will fix it

In addition to the rocket did not staggered like a drunken struts to fix it, and download a small plug of ferram4, is on the first page

1. Ah. Thank you for that tip. I'll try it next time I fly.

2. Thrust to Weight Ratio. 1.2:1 (thrust is 1.2 times more than the rocket weighs) is ideal for KSP. Gets you off the pad in a reasonable amount of time, but you don't have to throttle back as you climb.

3. The Buran-T pod doesn't create a massive slowdown like the core and boosters do. Not sure what's going on.

I do have Kerbal Joint Reinforcement. I also used struts. It's the overreaction of the engines that causes MechJeb to have some severe control issues.
